articles.headline: House Bill Raises Chance for Global Pact to Curb Corporate Tax Havens
articles.snippet: Several big details remain to be worked out before an international October deadline.
articles.abstract: Several big details remain to be worked out before an international October deadline.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The prospect of the largest overhaul to the global tax system in a century took a step forward this week as top Democrats introduced a plan to rewrite tax rules for multinational companies in a way that would allow the United States to join the rest of the world in an effort to crack down on tax havens.

articles.headline: As California Votes, It Rethinks Its Tradition of Direct Democracy
articles.snippet: Any proposed changes to a century-old recall law are likely to be met with stiff opposition from Republicans, who see it as one of the last avenues of influence in a Democratic-led state.
articles.abstract: Any proposed changes to a century-old recall law are likely to be met with stiff opposition from Republicans, who see it as one of the last avenues of influence in a Democratic-led state.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — As Californians went to the polls on Tuesday to determine whether Gov. Gavin Newsom would be removed from office, the recall election had already spawned another campaign: to recall the recall.
articles.byline: By Thomas Fuller, Maggie Astor and Conor Dougherty

articles.headline: Newsom’s Anti-Trump Recall Strategy Offers Republicans a Warning for 2022
articles.snippet: California Democrats were able to nationalize the vote — thanks to an avalanche of money, party discipline and, above all, an easily demonized opponent.
articles.abstract: California Democrats were able to nationalize the vote — thanks to an avalanche of money, party discipline and, above all, an easily demonized opponent.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN LEANDRO, Calif. — California basks in its clairvoyance. “The future happens here first,” says Gov. Gavin Newsom, calling his state “America’s coming attraction.”

articles.headline: Climate Change Calls for Backup Power, and One Company Cashes In
articles.snippet: Generac, a Wisconsin-based manufacturer that dominates the market for standby home generators, is an unlikely Wall Street darling.
articles.abstract: Generac, a Wisconsin-based manufacturer that dominates the market for standby home generators, is an unlikely Wall Street darling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Living on the South Carolina coast means living under the threat of dangerous weather during storm season. But the added peril of the pandemic made Ann Freeman nervous.

articles.headline: The Greatest Killer in New Orleans Wasn’t the Hurricane. It Was the Heat.
articles.snippet: A huge power failure after Hurricane Ida left vulnerable residents in sweltering apartments for days. At least 10 deaths in the city have been tied to the heat.
articles.abstract: A huge power failure after Hurricane Ida left vulnerable residents in sweltering apartments for days. At least 10 deaths in the city have been tied to the heat.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — In many ways, Iley Joseph’s one-bedroom apartment was an ideal place to ride out a hurricane. It was on the third floor — much too high to flood — of a building that was sturdy and new, part of a sleek, gated community for older residents like him.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Katy Reckdahl

articles.headline: This Is Life in Rural Afghanistan After the Taliban Takeover
articles.snippet: Since the Taliban takeover, much of Afghanistan’s countryside has seen a big drop in violence after 20 years of fighting. “It has been a long time now since a bullet hit our homes.”
articles.abstract: Since the Taliban takeover, much of Afghanistan’s countryside has seen a big drop in violence after 20 years of fighting. “It has been a long time now since a bullet hit our homes.”
articles.lead_paragraph: CHAK-E WARDAK, Afghanistan — Sixty bone-rattling miles southwest of Kabul, remnants of America’s longest war are abundant. Pillaged outposts scatter the hilltops, and skeletons of burned-out police pickup trucks and Humvees litter the road that weaves through the valleys in between.
